section.name: Using Apache WSS4J
section.p: This page describes how to use Apache WSS4J, either in a standalone manner, or in conjunction with other software packages.

subsection.name: Standalone
subsection.p: Apache WSS4J provides a set of APIs to implement WS-Security functionality on a SOAP message. It is possible to use these APIs directly in a standalone manner. The best way of finding out how to do this is to take a look at the test sources. For example:

subsection.name: Apache CXF
subsection.p: Apache CXF is an open-source web services stack. CXF uses WSS4J to perform the core WS-Security functionality, and provides extended security functionality based around the WS-SecurityPolicy, WS-SecureConversation and WS-Trust specifications. More information:

subsection.name: Apache Rampart
subsection.p: Apache Rampart is the security module for the Axis2 web services stack. Rampart uses WSS4J to perform the core WS-Security functionality, and provides extended security functionality based around the WS-SecurityPolicy, WS-SecureConversation and WS-Trust specifications.
